intro: Rhizakenia, commonly known as the false dandelion, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Asteraceae. These plants are characterized by their basal rosettes of leaves and showy, yellow or orange composite flowers that attract pollinators. Rhizakenia species typically have a taproot system, which allows them to store water and nutrients efficiently. They are often found in dry, sandy soils and are adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. The genus includes several species, some of which are used in traditional medicine or horticulture.
